poem:
**The Sculptor's Awakening**  

In midnight's quiet grip,  
shaped by restless dreams,  
ideas forge from ether to hand.  
Fingers trace the cold bronze,  
curves capturing whispers of time.  
Once hurled, food now forms  
a language of weight,  
turns into shadows cast  
on sterile gallery walls,  
a dance of shape and silence,  
telling stories of rebuke and triumph.

One restless night, an idea comes to you. You work it up in your studio and send it off to the foundry, to be cast in bronze. Finally, you’re ready to show it to the world, but the first person through the gallery". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
